WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FARMERS EAT?
A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives, Room 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: Carl Huglerud
Address: Outlook, Sask.
Birthplace: Norway

1. INTRODUCTION QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in western Canada? 1904
Where did you set up housekeeping? Outlook
Where had you been living before that? U.S.A.
For how many people did you prepare meals? 2
How far was it to your nearest store? 30
How often could a visit be made to the store? 3 months
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Flour, coffee, sugar, apples, dry fruit.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? No, we used mill flour.
In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lbs.
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $2.50
How much did you use graham flour? 2 lbs. a month
Whole wheat flour? 2 lbs. a month
Was flour milled locally? No, far away? Yes, that year? 1910
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? $0.50
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal? Whole wheat? Farina?
Other?
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge?
How did you grind it?
